body.name: Hisense 43-Inch Class R6090G Roku 4K UHD Smart TV with Alexa Compatibility (43R6090G, 2020 Model)
body.stockDetail: Only 4 left in stock - order soon.
features: Powered by exclusive technologies to amplify color, contrast, brightness, and smooth motion, the Hisense UHD smart TV combines incredible, ultra-bright 4k detail with the intuitively smart Roku TV to take your TV experience to the next level

TV Dimensions: Without stand – 37.8" W x 22" H x 3.3" D | With stand – 37.8" W x 24.1" H x 7.7" D | Screen size – 42.5” measured diagonally | Voltage – 120V, 60Hz | VESA pattern – 200x300 (M6 screw size) | Brightness rating – 300 nits. No local dimming

Control the TV with your iOS or android device via the easy-to-use Roku TV remote app, or use your voice to power your TV on and off, change channels, search for shows, and more through an Alexa-enabled device (sold separately) | Not Bluetooth compatible

Roku TV's simplified home screen and streamlined remote provide easy to access your cable box or HDTV antenna, one-touch access to favorite channels and streaming services, and access to over 5,000 streaming channels and 500,000 movies and TV episodes

Inputs/outputs: HDMI – 3 (2.0b inputs) | USB – 1 | Ethernet – 1 | RF Antenna – 1 | RCA Composite Video Input – 1 | L/R Audio Input for Composite – 1 | Digital audio output – 1 Optical | Earphone/audio output – 1
body.description: Perfect for presenting your favorite movies, shows, sports, and gaming, the Hisense 43R6090G 43-inch 4K UHD Smart TV creates astonishing images with enhanced color, details and depth to transform your favorite entertainment into an ultra-new reality. Powered by exclusive technologies to amplify color, contrast, brightness, and smooth motion, the Hisense Roku TV R6090G series UHD smart TVs combine incredible, ultra-bright 4K detail with the intuitively smart Roku TV to take your TV experience from great to incredible. Great for streaming, cable, satellite, gaming, and free over-the-air TV, this TV is perfect for presenting your favorite entertainment with enhanced color and more depth. Enjoy all the key moments in fast-paced sports, movies, and games with motion rate 120-image processing, minimizing picture lag to create a clear image without motion blur. This TV features a wide color gamut to increase the display's total array of colors, giving you a full spectrum of over a billion colors and amping up the intensity for a more lifelike picture. Roku TV's simplified home screen and streamlined remote provide easy to access your cable box or HDTV antenna, one-touch access to favorite channels and streaming services, and access to over 5,000 streaming channels and 500,000 movies and TV episodes. Control the TV with your iOS or android device via the easy-to-use Roku TV remote app, or use your voice to power your TV on and off, change channels, search for shows, and more through an Alexa-enabled device (sold separately). The Vesa measurements of this TV are 200 x 200mm, for wall mounting purposes. Wall mounts sold separately. Backed by a 1-year manufacturer's warranty, and includes a Roku remote (batteries included), power cable, and quick start guides.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great value for 4K TV.
reviews.reviewText: For the price, it's hard to complain about what you get with this 43" TV. It has a good picture, a small frame bezel and is very lightweight. It's fast. After setup, it powers on and is usable in about 2 seconds. Also, the Roku unit in the 4K TV models has their best, snappiest hardware so the user interface on this TV is incredibly fast too. I occasionally use my TVs as a secondary PC monitor so I also bought this model over others due to the reviews showing it to be a good PC monitor with low input lag. (I have not tested yet)RE: POOR REVIEWS: I've seen people complaining about Roku charging them $. As a 12 year user of Roku devices, I have no clue what these people are talking about. It's free. As for "ads" being shown, just to clarify, it's just ads for more channels/apps to ad, they are occasional tiny little boxes off to the side... it's not like buying a Fire tablet where it has a random ad every time you turn it on. It's just offers to subscribe to Hulu and whatnot.This TV has no bluetooth. People seem to be surprised, so don't be, it isn't there. This is a low price, bare bones 4K tv with a nice interface. Don't expect the moon from it and you should be pleased. Remember, 4K for $250. (!)The remote is just a generic Roku remote. Which means BASIC. Volume is on the side. If you want buttons for picture/sound (etc), you will hate this basic remote. It doesn't feel cheap, but it lacks the 50 buttons you may be used to. I actually like only having a few buttons as I was already running my previous TV from my Roku Stick remote.RE: brand: Hisense is unknown to me until now, but a little research reveals that they bought up Toshiba's TV division and used to be who made what were known as "Sharp" TVs until last year (and a lot more if you look), so not some unknown player at all.NOTE: for variable volume out: This TV only delivers a fixed volume from the audio output (optical), so you have to use the 3.5mm "headphone" jack if you wish to control external speaker volume with the TV remote. I just ran a 3.5mm-to-RCA cord to my bookshelf 2.1 setup.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2020
reviews.reviewText: My wife and I lived in a hotel for a month while we looked for a new home after moving across country. We got used to a 47" TV in bedroom. So when I set up our new 43" Hisense, my wife was a little disappointed (even though the one we used to have in the bedroom at the old house was an ancient 35"). I like it just fine.And I REALLY liked how light it is. Just 18 lbs! For an old guy, this is a big issue. I bought a nice support table/rack for it and hanging it on the top was a breeze. (This is in stark contrast to the trouble I had with my 55" in the living room that I could hardly pick up).The picture looks great to me and I watch from far enough away (about seven feet) not to be distracted by really fine detail. Color is good. And the sound is decent, too. I bought a small sound bar for it and it is superior - no big surprise there. But it isn't by as much as I expected. I could probably have saved that money.I was a little nervous when I realized the only remote in the box was a ROKU remote. And it took me a while to find the volume control on the side of the remote (though it didn't matter once the sound bar was installed). And that's the only reason I've deducted a star. I couldn't figure out how to get the ROKU remote to control the sound bar. I visited every audio setting I could find on the menu system without luck. I would love to not need the sound bar remote. But I have to do it with my big one downstairs, too. In general the menu offers you all the things you would normally look for on the TV remote. The Source button that I missed turns out not to be an issue at all. There are HDMI port selections available right on the screen, so I can switch from ROKU to my cable box with one click.Overall a great experience for a modest investment.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome features for a great price!
reviews.reviewText: This is my first Roku TV, and I really like the intuitive operation, plus the add-ons and operating features.The picture quality is amazing at 4K UHD, the backlighting is not just the edges, but full Direct lighting. I think that makes the images consistent across the screen, and side angle is very good.I did my research and found for the price this TV had the best of most all options available. Granted, it's not an 8K, and the $1K plus TVs are going to be better, but this Hisense is affordable with great features.That includes newly released options that about a year ago made prices more than 50% higher for the same thing. This TV has additional must-have options for sound systems. I bought a Soundbar with DTS VirtualX Sound and Dolby, ordered the correct HDMI cord, because this unit has the HDMI-Arc port, which requires high-speed HDMI cable for best quality- keep that in mind if you want to hook up a great sound system with HDMI 2.1 or better and be compatible. My cord is 8K HDMI 2.1 Cable 48Gbps. That is important because standard HDMI cables are typically 18Gbps, and your system sound will be disappointing.Overall, this was a great buy, a steal for what it cost compared to similar models with the same options. I love it, and I recommend it for budget-minded people who enjoy movies, gaming, music and streaming videos. 43" is a great size for smaller rooms, even the kids play room when they haul out the PS5 or XBox.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewText: We’ve had this TV for 2 years and 10 months! Out of the blue it started to reboot itself continuously and not remain powered on. It was a great TV experience for what it was but disappointing to see it malfunction so soon.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Do your Apt. researsh..RUKU has most!!
reviews.reviewText: Can,t day enough about a RUKU tv! Apt,s are really what you want to watch ALL tv programing! You don't need any other remote to get what you watch...everything is done with your RUKU tv. It really is a great tv..I have 3 of them..55..46..42 in.there all great watching..TK....
